Schema Faker Data generation for schema-registered objects.

In the course of application development, there is often a need to generate fake data on demand. Given all the information that we have about the schemas provided, translating that into data generation is fairly straightforward. The generation utility is built upon faker, mapping data types, and various field names into specific faker generation routines. By default all types are mapped as-is:
  • string
  • number
  • Date
  • boolean
  • Enumerations as string or number types.
  • Provided regular expressions:
    • email
    • url
    • telephone
    • postalCode
  • Sub-schemas as registered via @Schema decorators.
In addition to the general types, the code relies upon name matching to provide additional refinement: An example of this would be:
